channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Zebra crossing stripes, 30th August
item.description:
The zebra crossing here - the first "stripe" (formed by the surface of the road) - is currently greater than 1.3m wide, ie. the black surface at the start of the crossing is too large (highlighted in red in attached image). I know it's a curved corner, but I don't think it's right. Perhaps the kerb needs to be built out and the stripes reconfigured. Even if an extra stripe were added as it is now, it would have to be uniform width, and I think the corner curve would still cause issues with too much black space between the kerb and the first white stripe (ie. more than 1.3m). Please could this be looked into? This from the TSM: 16.2.9. The stripes immediately adjacent to the edge of the carriageway must be black and be not more than 1.3 m wide. All other stripes, both black and white, must be of equal width and not less than 500 mm nor more than 715 mm wide. Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, New Cavendish Street, Marylebone, Camden Town, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped garden waste, 30th August
item.description:
There has been fly tipping on and off in this alleyway, this waste has been there for 2 days. I would be almost sure the same people fly tip elsewhere in the borough, there are sometimes things dumped on Woldham Road. It is a nuisance. Please clear it, it will be hugely appreciated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gundulph Road, Widmore, London

item.title: Outside 3 and 6 Streatley Place NW3 1HP, 30th August
item.description:
The builders who carried out works at Heathside School (84a Heath St, London NW3 1DN) have a back entrance that comes out onto Streatley Place and the builders have left lots of paint all over the pavement from the schools back entrance all over Streatley Place NW3 1HP and all the way to Back Lane NW3 1HL. They caused this as they moved rubbish, rubble and paint from the works carried out at the school on 29 August 2025. Please can you arrange for this to be rectified and school billed as the Streatley Place is a conservation area and Yorkstone pavement is currently stained with white paint
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Streatley Place, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
